text: This mall has generously decided to create a thriving metropolitan ecosystem for our six-legged friends! Their toilets and common areas appear to be hosting an impressive cockroach convention ðŸª³ðŸŒ´

Many restaurants within this shopping centre. Eateries and cafe. Mall not crowded durour visit on a Weekday afternoon.  Its good if you looking for a place for meal. Their a supermarket specialised with Halal products.  Its a rather new mall when we visited. Some shops were still empty.
Easily accessed mall from Paya Lebar station. Couple of new tenants. There is a playground for children too . Nice epok2 and pisang horeng at the ground floor only Malay stall

Had a massage session with Na Na and she was very skilled and friendly, with firm and strong hands guided by experience. Her friendly demeanour made the session more enjoyable. She knew the areas to focus on and improved my well-being and constitution!
Not bad but the food court on B1 floor is a joke. A vibe of "make-do", without a dedicated drink/coffee stall.
